thread.title: Mughal Garden to have roses named after President Pranab Mukherjee and his wife
thread.title_full: Mughal Garden to have roses named after President Pranab Mukherjee and his wife

author: FE Online
title: Mughal Garden to have roses named after President Pranab Mukherjee and his wife
text:
Mughal Garden to have roses named after President Pranab Mukherjee and his wife Mughal Garden to have roses named after President Pranab Mukherjee and his wife President Pranab Mukherjee opened the annual 'Udyanotsav' of Rashtrapati Bhavan and the main attraction of the event were the flowers named after President and his wife. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 4, 2017 2:12 PM The Mughal Garden will now have two new varieties of roses named ‘President Pranab’ and ‘Suvra Mukherjee’. (Source: Reuters) 
On Saturday, President Pranab Mukherjee opened the annual ‘Udyanotsav’ of Rashtrapati Bhavan and the main attraction of the event were the flowers named after President and his wife. The Mughal Garden will now have two new varieties of roses named ‘President Pranab’ and ‘Suvra Mukherjee’. 
These two varieties were developed by Prabir Kumar Maity and Ashok Kumar Maity of Pushpanjali Rose Nursery at Jakpur, West Bengal. The varieties were planted in the garden after the Indian Rose Federation issued a certificate after trials in January 2017. 
Another important addition are the vertical Gardens and Air Purifying Plants which absorb toxins from polluted air. About 14,000 Tulip bulbs in seven different colors such as red, orange, pink, and purple have been planted in the Mughal Gardens. Several beds of roses, including both new and heritage varieties are the main attraction of the Long garden. 
You may also want to watch: 

Flower Carpets in various designs will be on display in the Central Lawns of the Rashtrapati Bhavan. The dominant color scheme of this year’s ornamental flowers is various shades of yellow, red and orange. A small cactus corner, as in previous years, forms part of the display. Exhibition Stalls will be set up near the Spiritual Garden displaying produce of fresh vegetables and fruits grown in the President’s Estate Organic Farm. The Spiritual Garden will also showcase a Lotus pond with a cascading waterfall. 
The Mughal Gardens will remain open for general public from February 05 to March 12, 2017 (except on Mondays which are maintenance days) between 09:30 A.M. to 04:00 P.M. Members of the public will also be able to visit the Spiritual Garden, Herbal Garden, Bonsai Garden and Musical Garden. 
The Mughal Gardens will be open exclusively on March 10, 2017 to special category of visitors viz farmers, differently abled persons, defence/para-military forces and Delhi Police personnel from 09:30 A.M. to 04:00 P.M. The Tactile Garden will be open for visually impaired people on March 10, 2017 from 11:00 A.M. to 04:00 P.M. 
(with input from agencies)
